# Arpeggio: add4 in A (Shape: D)

An arpeggio is a musical technique where notes of a chord are played one after the other. The arpeggio add4 in A played using the D shape involves playing the notes A, C#, E, and D.

## Notes and Intervals

- A (Root)
- C# (Major third)
- E (Perfect fifth)
- D (Added fourth)

## Genre and Flavor

The arpeggio add4 in A played with the D shape can evoke a dreamy or ethereal quality due to the added fourth note. It can fit well in various genres such as ambient, dream pop, or modern jazz, adding a sense of tension and color to the music.
